Award.AwardTitle: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2019 IFIP/IEEE International Symposium on Integrated Network Management (IM'19)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)/International Federation for Information Processing (IFIP) Symposium on Integrated Network and Service Management (IM) is a leading conference in network and service management community. The IM 2019 conference will be held April 8-12, 2019 in Washington DC, USA. The conference brings together researchers and practitioners from academia and industry which provides a multidisciplinary trend-setting forum to explore the hottest areas of information and communications technology management related to industry, academia, government, enterprise and other market segments from around the world. Attending conferences such as IM is of paramount importance for the development of graduate students. Students will have the opportunity to touch frontier research topics in the area of network and service management and establish collaboration relationships with other researchers during the conference.

Broader Impact: This project provides travel support for high school, undergrad or graduate students in the United States to attend the IM 2019 conference. The travel awards will focus on bringing in first-time attendees and under-represented minority students into the conference, since attending conferences is an important part of their educational experience, and they often have limited travel funds. The research community and the technical workforce benefit from the improvement of students in the pipeline, and new ideas generated through introducing new participants into the research field.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The PI (Carol Fung) received an NSF grant of amount $14,410 (Award #1916047) in 2019 to support US students to travel to Washington DC to attend the IEEE/IFIP International Symposium on Integrated Networks (IM 2019). With this grant we were able to support 9 US students with their travel expense to IM 2019. The list of recipients are listed as follows:

Name  Woman or under represented  Institution  Department  Has a paper  First time participant  Degree  Flight carrier  Amount Reimbursed

Farooq, Abdullah N University of North Carolina Computer Science N N PhD American Airline 1823.63

Jakaria, AHM N Florida International University Computer Science N Y PhD Southwest Airline 1161.76

Qu, Chengyi N(F) University of Missouri Computer Science N Y PhD United Airline 1823.63

Jaiyeola, Mercy Y (F) Mississipi State University Computer Science Y Y PhD Delta Airline 1823.63

Zhou, Junxiu Y (F) University of Arkansas Computer Science Y Y PhD Delta Airline 1823.63

Zhang, Mingwei N University of Oregon Computer Science Y Y PhD - 1823.64

Rustgi, Pulkit N Virginia Commonwealth University Computer Science Y Y Msc - 472.82

Shi, Pinyi N University of Kentucky Computer Science N Y PhD Delta Airline 1823.63

Kiani Mehr, Sheyda Y (F) University of Missouri Kansas City Computer Science Y Y PhD United Airline 1823.63

Zhou Siyu M New York University Electronic and Computer Engineering N Y PhD - 0.00

 

After the conference, the PI conducted a survey on the grant recipients and received 6 responds. The survey results show that students are positive to the conference experience and it did increase their interest in the field of computer science and technology.


Last Modified: 03/04/2020
Modified by: Carol Fung
